parameters:
"Oh!! Thank you for coming. I've heard about it earlier;
you've accepted my request, haven't you?"

"Yes, this time it's a new species of monster that's even
affecting the ecosystem, so I was called in just in case."

"Is that so, is that so. Ah, to think that Tina-san, a
swordsman and member of the Hero Party, would be our
escort!!"
(Well, it's actually to keep an eye on you, though.)

"I believe you've already been informed, but let me tell you
about the current situation as well."

"Firstly, regarding the location of the new species of
monsters, it seems that mutated creatures have appeared in
the Tebyurus next to our town and in the Krie Cave that lies
between our cities."

"Selphie said the same thing. So the shortest route would be
through Lasra Forest, I suppose?"

"Yes, exactly. And now, as mentioned before, Lasra Forest
and Krie Cave are under strict travel restrictions and no
one is allowed to enter."

"Of course, we have permission to enter. However, since
there's no one else around, we must be very careful of
monsters and such."
(That makes it a perfect environment to set a trap.)
"I understand the situation. When do we depart?"

"It's a bit sudden, but I would like to depart first thing
tomorrow morning."
At those words, Maroges showed a troubled expression.

"Even though there are other paths, the cave that connects
the towns is quite important, you see."

"Even if some monsters appear, it's inconvenient for
adventurers when they can't use the shortest route. There
are many voices saying it should be dealt with as soon as
possible."

"Besides, there's a warehouse I manage near that cave, so
it's quite troublesome in many ways."

(I see. I had a feeling there was a reason for the rush, but
it's because you're worried about your warehouse being
ransacked.)

"Understood. Shall we meet at the town entrance tomorrow
morning?"

"Now that we've finished discussing, although it's just a
formality, could you enter into a contract of servitude?"

The contract of servitude is said to be an ancient magical
formula used in the past by nobles to prevent those they
employed from escaping when making agreements.

This contract of servitude not only prevents escape but can
also temporarily brainwash and force compliance for the
purpose of making someone work against their will.

However, as it is called an ancient magical formula, it is
only mentioned in documents as having been used in the past,
and its structure is not fully understood in modern times.

In essence, it's a remnant of contracts with nobility,
without any real effect or causing anything in particular to
happen.

Nowadays, even among nobles, many find it too troublesome
and do not engage in it. It is only done formally by high-
ranking nobles or during important ceremonies.

"A contract of servitude? You don't strike me as someone who
fusses over noble pretenses."

At Tina's words, Maroges scratched his cheek and said,
"That's true."

"As you say, I'm not particularly concerned with such
formalities. However, there's a group of newly entered
nobles who are quite particular about these things."

"And so, despite finding it bothersome, I am being made to
do this."

High-ranking nobles value appearances. In other words, the
more power and money a noble has, the more they tend to
adhere to these formalities.

Tina thought that Maroges must be going through this tedious
formality as a result of trying to curry favor with someone
of higher status and power.

"Hmm, well alright. If that's the case, let's get it over
with quickly."

"Understood," Maroges said as he extended his hand towards
Tina. In response, Tina crouched down to lower her body.

"Now then... Until the mission is complete, Tina shall be in
servitude to me, without any rebellion or acting to my
detriment,"

"Become a slave and devote yourself to me. Do you
understand?"

Tina nodded her head silently in agreement. With this, the
contract of servitude was concluded.
A sudden chill ran through Tina's body.
With a burst of energy, Tina stood up and looked at Maroges.
Surprised by Tina's behavior, Maroges took a step back.

"(There's no sign that Maroges did anything, nor any trace
of skill use.)"

"(Besides, my Full Body works against skills too. The fact
that it didn't react means I wasn't attacked with a skill.)"

"(Is it just my imagination? Was that chill just me
overthinking?)"

Once she considered it to be her imagination, the skepticism
within Tina faded away as if under a spell.
"No, it's nothing. I just felt a little restless."

With that said, Tina shook her head as if to cast off the
feeling.

"Well, now that our business is concluded, I'll be taking my
leave for today."

Whether still feeling the discomfort or just eager to leave,
she turned to go.

"Oh, Miss Tina, before you leave, there's one more important
matter you're forgetting."

As Tina turned back to ask if there was anything else,
Maroges had an oddly creepy grin on his face.

"Hehehe, about the duties of a female swordsman tomorrow, I
thought we might need to align our understanding of common
sense a bit."
